Node.definition: = inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.

Node.gloss: to break > to bring to an end
Node.definition: literally: to break an event; hence: = causative action by which someone brings an event to an end
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= process by which an event comes to an end ◄ as if it were a fire that is extinguished

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= people who speak to or about someone who is in some sort of difficulty in a contemptuous way ► in order to subject that person to ridicule
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
literally: (one's) eye remains (on something)

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place

Node.gloss: to pledge|to promise|to put up security
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= causative action by which someone strikes the palm of their hand against someone else's palm; ► in order to show that one has taken responsibility for someone else's debts; ≈ usually regarded as unwise

= causative action by which someone strikes the palm of their hand against someone else's palm; ► in order to show that one has taken responsibility for someone else's debts; ≈ usually regarded as unwise
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= causative action by which humans keep other humans, their minds, or forces of nature from being engaged in a certain event
literally: to make high; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities grant an elevated status to humans in the eyes of other people
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
literally: (one's) eyes are finished; hence: = process by which someone's eyes become affected by excessive weeping or hardship
literally: to place as a byword; hence: = causative action by which deities cause humans to be the object of ridicule
literally: to weaken; hence: = process by which parts of the human body gradually lose their ability to function as they should
= state in which human experience displeasure, which is said to reside in their heart (לֵב) ◄ and is caused by their own condition or by someone else

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
meaning unsure; possibly: = the limbs of the human body, ◄ described as artifacts produced by an artisan shaping clay
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
= state in which humans are not held responsible for actions committed in the past or for future commitments
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
= action by which someone ends a period of inactivity and comes into action, ◄ as if he had been sleeping for a certain time

Node.gloss: to hold on (to a type of behavior)
Node.definition: literally: to hold on to a quality as if it were a person; hence: = to act in accordance with a certain quality
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state in which humans or deities are free from moral contamination
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: to add; hence: = process by which a certain quality of humans increases in intensity, either in actual fact or in the eyes of others
= state in which humans have physical, political, and/or military strength
= marker indicating that the information that follows is in contrast with what has preceded
= process by which humans or objects come upon (other) humans or objects without searching
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= a project or scheme as conceived in the heart or mind, which can be either bad or good
= things that one would like to have or see happen
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
literally: to spread out one's bed (somewhere); hence: = to make one's home in a certain area
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= a location, ◄ compared to a father, ≈ regarded as a source of security and comfort
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= friendly and endearing way to address a woman
= friendly and endearing way to address a woman

= small, soft, legless, tube shaped creatures that have no bones or shells; they typically feed on overripe fruit, rotting meat, and similar things; most are larvae that hatch from the eggs laid by flies or some beetles; associated with uncleanness, mortality, decay, and death
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the (often rhetorical) question whether an event may ever take place at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities perceive with their minds

= state in which an object is an integrated part of a larger unit or substance|= long, slender piece of wood; ◄ made from a straight branch or tree; ► used for carrying objects or for locking gates from the inside

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

Node.gloss: to go down (to the netherworld)|to die
Node.definition: literally: to go down (to the netherworld, death, the pit, the dust, silence, etc.); hence: = process by which humans die and descend into the world of the dead

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface
